p:
A related invasive, wind dispersed perennial C4 grass, Cenchrus setaceus (Forssk.) Morrone (fountain grass) , showed a strong relationship between precipitation and total seed production
55 and precipitation and fecundity
56 . These factors, related to propagule pressure, can be expected to contribute to the observed effect of precipitation on buffelgrass infilling rate. In the eastern United States, propagule rain and disturbance were the most important predictors of changes in abundance of three different invasive plant species
57 . Buffelgrass also exhibits a strong growth response to precipitation
31 . Future research exploring buffelgrass infill rates, and the influence of precipitation on this rate, may decrease uncertainty in model simulations.
